name: windshift

procedures: T1027::[Windshift] has used string encoding with floating point calculations.
T1033::[Windshift] has used malware to identify the username on a compromised host.
T1036.001::[Windshift] has used revoked certificates to sign malware.
T1036::[Windshift] has used icons mimicking MS Office files to mask malicious executables.
T1047::[Windshift] has used WMI to collect information about target machines.
T1057::[Windshift] has used malware to enumerate active processes.
T1059.005::[Windshift] has used Visual Basic 6 (VB6) payloads.
T1071.001::[Windshift] has used tools that communicate with C2 over HTTP.
T1082::[Windshift] has used malware to identify the computer name of a compromised host.
T1105::[Windshift] has used tools to deploy additional payloads to compromised hosts.
T1189::[Windshift] has used compromised websites to register custom URL schemes on a remote system.
T1204.001::[Windshift] has used links embedded in e-mails to lure victims into executing malicious code.
T1204.002::[Windshift] has used e-mail attachments to lure victims into executing malicious code.
T1518.001::[Windshift] has used malware to identify installed AV and commonly used forensic and malware analysis tools.
T1518::[Windshift] has used malware to identify installed software.
T1547.001::[Windshift] has created LNK files in the Startup folder to establish persistence.
T1566.001::[Windshift] has sent spearphishing emails with attachment to harvest credentials and deliver malware.
T1566.002::[Windshift] has sent spearphishing emails with links to harvest credentials and deliver malware.
T1566.003::[Windshift] has used fake personas on social media to engage and target victims.

description: [Windshift](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0112) is a threat group that has been active since at least 2017, targeting specific individuals for surveillance in government departments and critical infrastructure across the Middle East.(Citation: SANS Windshift August 2018)(Citation: objective-see windtail1 dec 2018)(Citation: objective-see windtail2 jan 2019)
